title: Adagrad calls contiguous instead of coalesce with sparse parameters and breaks in v0.1.12
body_html:
Calling Adagrad.step() appears to break if you have a sparse embedding layer:

/torch/optim/adagrad.py in step(self, closure)
     65 
     66                 if p.grad.data.is_sparse:
---> 67                     grad.contiguous()  # the update is non-linear so indices must be unique
     68                     grad_indices = grad.indices()
     69                     grad_values = grad.values()

AttributeError: 'torch.sparse.FloatTensor' object has no attribute 'contiguous'

It looks like this is due to the v0.1.12 update: "On sparse Tensors, contiguous is renamed to coalesce".

body:
Calling Adagrad.step() appears to break if you have a sparse embedding layer:

```(python)
/torch/optim/adagrad.py in step(self, closure)
     65 
     66                 if p.grad.data.is_sparse:
---> 67                     grad.contiguous()  # the update is non-linear so indices must be unique
     68                     grad_indices = grad.indices()
     69                     grad_values = grad.values()

AttributeError: 'torch.sparse.FloatTensor' object has no attribute 'contiguous'
```

It looks like this is due to the v0.1.12 update: "On sparse Tensors, `contiguous` is renamed to `coalesce`".
